channel.title: Need help
channel.description:
So far I have been doing chemistry questions for around 4 hours now and I'm just over half way and beginning to give up. Any ideas on how I can keep myself going through them.
(sensible ideas please).

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

I’m pretty sure your just going to want to do number of moles times 24000cm cubed=number of cubic centimeters for the number of moles of any given gas.

as for getting through them, short term goals, then take a break after each goal.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Ok just wondering if anyone knows how to do this

Calculation of the volume of a given number of moles of a gas (assume that all volumes are measured at room temperature and pressure and that 1 mole of gas has a volume of 24 000 cm^3 under these conditions.)

1 mole of CO2

if anyone wants feel free to do these

0.1 moles of NH3
0.5 moles of C2H4
2 moles of C2h4
0.12 moles of SO3
3.4 moles of HBr
0.11 moles of Cl2
0.0040 moles of CH4
10 moles of H2
0.45 moles of O2

Read full topic
